Package dev.gamekit.scene

Class Scene

java.lang.Object
dev.gamekit.scene.Scene
public abstract class Scene extends Object
A representation of a logical part of your application. This can be a main menu, testing area or a level within your game.

A scene can contain props which interact with each other to implement the goal of the scene.

  • Method Details

    • getActive

      public static Scene getActive()
      Returns the currently loaded scene instance
      Returns:
      Scene The active scene of the application

    • setActive

      public static void setActive(Scene scene)
      Sets the currently active scene instance. This is called internally by the application
      Parameters:
      scene - The active scene

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the scene
      Returns:
      The name of the scene

    • addChild

      public void addChild(Prop prop)
      Adds a Prop object to this scene
      Parameters:
      prop - The prop to be added

    • removeChild

      public void removeChild(Prop prop)
      Removes a Prop object from this scene
      Parameters:
      prop - The prop to be removed

    • onStart

      public void onStart()
      Called by the application to initialize the scene. It can be overridden to implement custom setup.

      Remember to call super.onStart()

    • onUpdate

      public void onUpdate()
      Called by the application's game loop to update the scene. It can be overridden to implement custom update logic.

      Remember to call super.onUpdate()

    • onRender

      public void onRender()
      Called by the application game loop to render the scene. It can be overridden to implement custom render logic.

      Use Renderer methods to draw to the window

      Remember to call super.onRender()

    • onDispose

      public void onDispose()
      Called by the application to dispose the scene It can be overridden to implement custom dispose logic.

      Remember to call super.onDispose()
